{{/compare}} {{#compare sprout.custom.mode "==" "pcp"}}


{{formatDate sprout.submissionDate "short"}}

Dear {{pcori_dsp_interventi.pcp_name_title.name}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.pcp_name}},

The caregiver of your patient, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.last_name}} (DOB {{pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_dob}}), is participating in a research project aimed at improving healthcare outcomes for patients with Down syndrome. The project is coordinated by a team of clinicians and researchers at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston and is funded by a grant from the Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute. More information about our project can be found at www.downsyndromeclinictoyou.com.

The caregiver of your patient completed an online questionnaire which generated automated suggestions for testing and treatment that are anchored on published practice guidelines and/or expert consensus. The online tool encouraged {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s caregiver to share and discuss these with you.

On the next page, you will find a checklist of these recommendations and list of educational resources specific for Down syndrome. We hope you will find them helpful during your next clinical visit with this patient.

Sincerely,

MGH Down Syndrome Program Research Team





P.S. As we are testing the efficacy of this intervention alone, we are not available for clinical consultation by phone or e-mail. If you have any technical questions, however, regarding the accessibility of this study's resources, please e-mail dsc2u@mgh.harvard.edu.



Personalized Checklist for {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s Provider

The caregiver of your patient completed an online questionnaire which generated automated suggestions for testing and treatment that are anchored on published practice guidelines and/or expert consensus.

This checklist does not establish a health care provider-patient relationship. It is not an attempt to practice medicine or provide specific clinical advice. It is intended to provide useful information to you for reference and educational purposes only. It contains auto-programmed suggestions based on answers provided by your patient's caregiver to the Down Syndrome Clinic to You (DSC2U) survey and on national guidelines. It was not prepared or reviewed by a clinician specifically for your patient. The content of this letter is not meant to be complete or exhaustive or to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. You are responsible for exercising independent judgment about the contents of this letter and for recommending and implementing any care or other course of action for your patient.


You might choose to check each item when completed for {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}.

{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_moyamoya "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_leukemia "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_infantile_spasms "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_urgent_cspine "1") )}}

Urgent Suggestions for {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}

Cervical X-ray (“C-spine”) should be considered to assess for atlantoaxial instability (AAI). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month, "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.neck_pain.value "==" "1"}}neck pain{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.walk_change.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "==" "1"}}new accidents with stool.{{/compare}} In symptomatic patients, the AAP recommends a neutral view (C-spine) be performed first; if no signs of AAI, then flexion and extension views should be performed subsequently. If the atlanto-dens interval (ADI) is greater than or equal to 4.5 mm on any of the three views, consultation with neurosurgery or orthopedics is recommended.

{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Cervical X-ray (“C-spine”) should be done to assess for atlantoaxial instability (AAI). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.torticollis.value "==" "1"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} head staying tilted to one side{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.ability_change.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.neck_pain.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.walk_change.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ability_change.value "==" "1"}}a decrease in activity or overall functioning{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.neck_pain.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.walk_change.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.neck_pain.value "==" "1"}}neck pain{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.walk_change.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.walk_change.value "==" "1"}}changes in how {{pcori_dsp_interventi.heshe}} walks{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "==" "1"}}new weakness in one or more limbs{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.arms_hands.value "==" "1"}}changes in how {{pcori_dsp_interventi.heshe}} uses arms or hands{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.accidents_urine.value "==" "1"}}new accidents with urine{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.incontinence_stool.value "==" "1"}}new accidents with stool.{{/compare}} Also, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has a past medical history of AAI, and they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a cervical x-ray within the last two months. We recommend obtaining a new C-spine X-ray to assess for any changes suggestive of worsening AAI.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<=" "10"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_seizures.value "!=" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.seizures.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Brain MRI should be done to assess for moyamoya. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.new_weakness.value "==" "1"}}new weakness in one or more limbs{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.seizures.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.seizures.value "==" "1"}}uncontrollable shaking of arms and legs{{/compare}}, which could be symptoms of moyamoya in children with Down syndrome younger than 10 years of age.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "6"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_all.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_aml.value "!=" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.fever.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.limp.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

CBC with differential should be done to assess for leukemia. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.fever.value "==" "1"}}fever that hasn't gone away in at least five days{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.limp.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.limp.value "==" "1"}}a new limp{{/compare}}, which could be symptoms for leukemia in people with Down syndrome younger than 6 years of age.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age_months "<=" "15"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_seizures.value "!=" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms2.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

An EEG (electroencephalogram) should be done to assess for infantile spasms. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms.value "==" "1"}}abnormal facial grimaces{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms2.value "==" "1"}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms3.value "==" "1"}},{{else}} and {{/compare}}{{else}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms3.value "==" "1"}} and {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms2.value "==" "1"}}jerking of arms or legs{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms3.value "==" "1"}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms.value "==" "1"}},{{/compare}} and {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.infantile_spasms3.value "==" "1"}}staring episodes.{{/compare}} Infantile spasms can occur in up to 10% of infants with Down syndrome up to the age of 15 months. If infantile spasms are suggested by EEG, prompt treatment by a pediatric neurologist is warranted.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}}

Recommended Labs, Tests, and Procedures for {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}

(AAP = American Academy of Pediatrics)

{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.audio_12m.value "==" "0"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<=" "6"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Audiogram/hearing test. The AAP recommends that all children with Down syndrome receive an audiogram every 6 months until hearing is confirmed in both ears, and then annually thereafter until age 21, given increased incidence of hearing loss in this population.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.audio_12m.value "==" "0"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">" "6"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Audiogram/hearing test. For ages 1 to 21, AAP recommends annual audiograms given increased incidence of hearing loss in this population.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.audio_2y.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Audiogram/hearing test. For ages 21 and over, experts recommend an audiogram every two years, given increased incidence of hearing loss in this population.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.audio_12m.value "==" "999"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<=" "6"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Audiogram/hearing test. The AAP recommends audiograms every six months until hearing is confirmed in both ears in children with Down syndrome, and then annually after that until age 21, given increased incidence of hearing loss in this population. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver is unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a hearing test within the past 12 months.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.audio_12m.value "==" "999"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">" "6"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Audiogram/hearing test. For ages 1 to 21, AAP recommends annual audiograms given increased incidence of hearing loss in this population. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver is unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a hearing test within the past 12 months.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.audio_2y.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Audiogram/hearing test. For ages 21 and over, experts recommend an audiogram every two years, given increased incidence of hearing loss in this population. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s caregiver is unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a hearing test within the past 2 years.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_1y.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: AAP recommends annual ophthalmologic exams for people with Down syndrome, ages 1 to 5.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_2y.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: AAP recommends an ophthalmologic exam at least every two years for people with Down syndrome, ages 5 to 13.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_3y.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: AAP recommends an ophthalmologic exam at least every three years for people with Down syndrome, ages 13 and 21.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_2yadult.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: Experts recommend an ophthalmologic exam at least every two years for adults with Down syndrome, ages 21 and older.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_1y.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: AAP recommends annual ophthalmologic exams for people with Down syndrome, ages 1 to 5. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had an eye exam within the past year of completing our intake.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_2y.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: AAP recommends an ophthalmologic exam at least every two years for people with Down syndrome, ages 5 to 13. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had an eye exam within the past two years of completing our intake.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ophtho_3y.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Ophthalmology Evaluation: AAP recommends an ophthalmologic exam at least every three years for people with Down syndrome, ages 13 and 21. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had an eye exam within the past three years of completing our intake.

learned skills.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver is also not sure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has ever had celiac testing done. Celiac disease is more common in people with Down syndrome. You should consider testing if celiac testing has never been done, or if it has not been done within the past 12 months.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.celiac_test.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.celiac_time.value "==" "0"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.celiacd.value "!=" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_celiac1 "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_celiac2 "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Celiac screen (total IgA & TTG-IgA). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.heshe}} had {{#compare {{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.celiac_test.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.celiac_time.value "==" "0"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.celiacd.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.gluten_free.value "==" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_celiac1 "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_celiac2 "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Celiac screen (total IgA & TTG-IgA). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.heshe}} had {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.constipation.value "==" "1"}}constipation that is hard to treat{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.diarrhea.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.nausea.value "1") (eq "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.bangs_head.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.irritable.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hits_others.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.mood_swings.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.property_destruction.value "==" "1"}}property destruction{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "==" "1"}}crying easily or for no reason{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}loss of previously learned skills.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.heshe}} already has a diagnosis of celiac disease and is on a gluten-free diet, but since {{pcori_dsp_interventi.heshe}} has not had celiac testing done within the past 12 months, repeat testing to assess for any residual gluten in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} diet might be helpful.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "4"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "0"}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s' caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has never had a sleep study. The AAP recommends that all children with Down syndrome be screened for obstructive sleep apnea by undergoing a sleep study by age four, even in the absence of symptoms, and then further sleep studies later in life if symptoms arise. The prevalence of obstructive sleep apnea in patients with Down syndrome is reported to be up to 75%. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "0"}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has never had a sleep study. Experts recommend that all individuals with Down syndrome be screened for obstructive sleep apnea by undergoing at least one sleep study in their lifetime. The prevalence of obstructive sleep apnea in patients with Down syndrome is reported to be up to 75%. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "0"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling asleep or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has also never had a sleep study. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome be evaluated for sleep apnea if symptoms arise. We would recommend a sleep study to assess for obstructive sleep apnea, which can occur in up to 75% of people with Down syndrome. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "0"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

{{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.chews_parts.value "==" "1"}}chewing body parts{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq easily or for no reason{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "==" "1"}}moving slowly{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}loss of previously learned skills{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "==" "1"}}eating too much or too little{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling asleep or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has also never had a sleep study. Experts recommend that everyone with Down syndrome be evaluated for sleep apnea if symptoms arise. We would recommend a sleep study to assess for obstructive sleep apnea, which can occur in up to 75% of people with Down syndrome. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "4"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "999"}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has ever had a sleep study. The AAP recommends that all children with Down syndrome be screened for obstructive sleep apnea by undergoing a sleep study by age four, even in the absence of symptoms, and then further sleep studies later in life if symptoms arise. The prevalence of obstructive sleep apnea in patients with Down syndrome is reported to be up to 75%. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "999"}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a sleep study. Experts recommend that all individuals with Down syndrome be screened for obstructive sleep apnea by undergoing at least one sleep study in their lifetime. The prevalence of obstructive sleep apnea in patients with Down syndrome is reported to be up to 75%. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "999"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "==" "1"}}crying easily or for no reason{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "==" "1"}}moving slowly{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}loss of previously learned skills{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "==" "1"}}eating too much or too little{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling asleep or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s caregiver was also unsure whether {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} ever had a sleep study. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome be evaluated for sleep apnea if symptoms arise. We would recommend a sleep study to assess for obstructive sleep apnea, which can occur in up to 75% of people with Down syndrome. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "999"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "==" "1"}}moving slowly{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}loss of previously learned skills{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "==" "1"}}eating too much or too little{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling asleep or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a sleep study within the past 12 months. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome be evaluated for sleep apnea if new symptoms arise. We would recommend a sleep study to assess for obstructive sleep apnea, which can occur in up to 75% of people with Down syndrome. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "18"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep_study.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.polysom_time.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.osa.value "!=" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_apnea "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_anxiety "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Sleep study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past month of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experienced {{#compare (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}loss of previously learned skills{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "==" "1"}}eating too much or too little{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling asleep or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a sleep study within the past 12 months, per his caregiver. Experts recommend that everyone with Down syndrome be evaluated for sleep apnea if new symptoms arise. We would recommend a sleep study to assess for obstructive sleep apnea, which can occur in up to 75% of people with Down syndrome. Research has also shown that patients with Down syndrome may lose up to 9 IQ points within a year when their apnea is untreated.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.thyroid_test.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Thyroid function tests (TSH & fT4): {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} thyroid levels drawn. The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that everyone with Down syndrome have their thyroid levels checked once annually, given the high incidence of thyroid disorders in patients with Down syndrome.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.thyroid_test.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Thyroid function tests (TSH & fT4). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} thyroid levels drawn. Experts recommend that everyone with Down syndrome have their thyroid levels checked once annually, given the high incidence of thyroid disorders in patients with Down syndrome.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.thyroid_test.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Thyroid function tests (TSH & fT4). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months of completing our intake, they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} thyroid levels drawn. The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that everyone with Down syndrome have their thyroid levels checked once annually, given the high incidence of thyroid disorders in patients with Down syndrome.

{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.thyroid_test.value "==" "999"}}

{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.thyroid_test.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_hypothyroid "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_hashimotos.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_hypothyroidism.value "!=" "1"}}

Thyroid function tests (TSH & fT4). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} thyroid levels drawn, and that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} also has hypothyroidism that is currently being treated. pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling asleep or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} These may be suggestive of hypothyroidism not adequately managed with the current dose of Levothyroxine. This can be common in people with Down syndrome, and we recommend more frequent testing to ensure optimal management of thyroid disorders.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.thyroid_test.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_hyperthyroid "==" "1"}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_hashimotos.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_hypothyroidism.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_graves.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_hyperthyroidism.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Thyroid function tests (TSH & fT4). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} thyroid levels drawn. However, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has also experienced symptoms such as {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.too_hot.value "==" "1"}}feeling too hot{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.chews_parts.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.irritable.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.situation_fear.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.chews_parts.value "==" "1"}}chewing body parts{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.irritable.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.situation_fear.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.irritable.value "==" "1"}}irritability{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.situation_fear.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.situation_fear.value "==" "1"}}fear of particular situations.{{/compare}} These may be suggestive of hyperthyroidism not adequately managed with the current medications. Experts recommend that everyone with Down syndrome have their thyroid levels checked once annually, and in the presence of {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s symptoms, repeat testing would be warranted.
{{/if}} {{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_anemia.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hgb.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Hemoglobin level. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a hemoglobin level. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome have a hemoglobin level checked annually to assess for iron-deficiency anemia. If Hg < 11, the AAP recommends one of these follow-up labs: (1) ferritin and CRP or (2) reticulocyte hemoglobin (CHr). If (1) CRP is normal and ferritin is low or (2) CHr is low, then iron augmentation through diet or supplements is recommended.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_anemia.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hgb.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Hemoglobin level. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a hemoglobin level, and they already have a diagnosis of anemia. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome have a hemoglobin level checked annually to monitor iron-deficiency anemia and adjust treatment options.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_anemia.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hgb.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Hemoglobin level. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are not sure if {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a hemoglobin level performed within the past 12 months. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome have a hemoglobin level checked annually to assess for iron-deficiency anemia. If Hg < 11, the AAP recommends one of these follow-up labs: (1) ferritin and CRP or (2) reticulocyte hemoglobin (CHr). If (1) CRP is normal and ferritin is low or (2) CHr is low, then iron augmentation through diet or supplements is recommended.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age "<" "21"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_anemia.value "==" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hgb.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Hemoglobin level. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that within the past 12 months of completing our intake, they were not sure if {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a hemoglobin level, and they already have a diagnosis of anemia. The AAP recommends that everyone with Down syndrome have a hemoglobin level checked annually to monitor iron-deficiency anemia and adjust treatment options.

{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "==" "0"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.conc_cough.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.aspiration_liquids.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Video Fluoroscopic Swallowing Study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experiences {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.conc_cough.value "==" "1"}}coughing when eating solid foods{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.aspiration_liquids.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.aspiration_liquids.value "==" "1"}}coughing, choking, or throat clearing while drinking{{/compare}}. Also, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a swallowing study within the past 12 months. Due to the high risk of aspiration pneumonia in patients with Down syndrome, we recommend a video fluoroscopic swallowing study for further evaluation.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "==" "999"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.conc_cough.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.aspiration_liquids.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Video Fluoroscopic Swallowing Study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experiences {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.conc_cough.value "==" "1"}}coughing when eating solid foods{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.aspiration_liquids.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.aspiration_liquids.value "==" "1"}}coughing, choking, or throat clearing while drinking{{/compare}}. Also, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver has indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a swallowing study within the past 12 months. Due to the high risk of aspiration pneumonia in patients with Down syndrome, we recommend a video fluoroscopic swallowing study for further evaluation, if this has not already been done.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_dementia.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_dementia "==" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "0") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "999") )}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.weight_loss.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_aspiration.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Video Fluoroscopic Swallowing Study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has recently experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.weight_loss.value "==" "1"}}weight loss{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.chewing.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.drinking_aspiration.value "1") (eq {{else}},{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.chewing.value "==" "1"}}more difficulty chewing in the last year{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.drinking_aspiration.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "==" "999"}}Also, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a swallowing study within the past 12 months.{{/compare}} Due to the high risk of aspiration pneumonia in patients with Down syndrome, we recommend a video fluoroscopic swallowing study for further evaluation.
{{/if}} {{/if}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_dementia.value "==" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "0") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "999") )}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.weight_loss.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_aspiration.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Video Fluoroscopic Swallowing Study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has recently experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.weight_loss.value "==" "1"}}weight loss{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.chewing.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.drinking_aspiration.value "1") (eq {{else}},{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.chewing.value "==" "1"}}more difficulty chewing in the last year{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.drinking_aspiration.value "1") (eq "1"}}regurgitating (vomiting) after eating or drinking{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.pills_food.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "1") )}}, {{else}},{{/if}}{{/compare}} Alzheimer’s disease. This is suggestive of impaired swallowing as part of ongoing dementia. {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "==" "0"}}Also, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver has indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a swallowing study within the past 12 months.{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "==" "999"}}Also, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has had a swallowing study within the past 12 months.{{/compare}} Due to the high risk of aspiration pneumonia in patients with Down syndrome, we recommend a video fluoroscopic swallowing study for further evaluation.

{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Dental visit. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not had a dental exam within the past 6 months.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.dentist.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Dental visit. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they were unsure if {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} had a dental exam within the past 6 months.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.colonca_screening.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Colonoscopy. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has never had screening for colon cancer. Research has demonstrated that colon cancer is less common in adults with Down syndrome. Colon cancer screening might still be appropriate, however, if there is a strong family history of colon cancer or other risk factors.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.colonca_screening.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Colonoscopy. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has ever had a colon cancer screening. Research has demonstrated that colon cancer is less common in adults with Down syndrome. Colon cancer screening might still be appropriate, however, if there is a strong family history of colon cancer or other risk factors.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.mammogram.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Mammogram. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has never had a mammogram. Research has demonstrated that breast cancer is less common in adults with Down syndrome. Experts specializing in Down syndrome still recommend that women with Down syndrome beginning at the age of fifty adhere to routine mammogram screening as in the general population (once every two years), particularly if there is a family history of breast cancer or other risk factors.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.mammogram.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Mammogram. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has ever had a mammogram. Experts specializing in Down syndrome still recommend that women with Down syndrome beginning at the age of fifty adhere to routine mammogram screening as in the general population (once every two years), particularly if there is a family history of breast cancer or other risk factors.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pap_smear.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Pap smear. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has never had a Pap smear. There is a very low risk of developing cervical cancer in the absence of having sexual intercourse. Nonetheless, experts specializing in Down syndrome recommend that adult women with Down syndrome consider having a Pap smear, particularly if they are sexually active. Performing a Pap smear on an adult woman who has not had sexual intercourse can be challenging, in which case a blind Pap smear may be attempted.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pap_smear.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Pap smear. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they were unsure if {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has ever had a Pap smear. There is a very low risk of developing cervical cancer in the absence of having sexual intercourse. Nonetheless, experts specializing in Down syndrome recommend that adult women with Down syndrome consider having a Pap smear, particularly if they are sexually active. Performing a Pap smear on an adult woman who has not had sexual intercourse can be challenging, in which case a blind Pap smear may be attempted.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_influenza.value "==" "2"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Flu shot. The same precautions and contraindications for the general population apply to people with Down syndrome. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} gets a flu shot “most years.”
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_influenza.value "==" "3"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Flu shot. The same precautions and contraindications for the general population apply to people with Down syndrome. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} gets a flu shot “some years.”
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_influenza.value "==" "4"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Flu shot. The same precautions and contraindications for the general population apply to people with Down syndrome. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} never gets a flu shot.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_influenza.value "==" "5"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Flu shot. The same precautions and contraindications for the general population apply to people with Down syndrome. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure how often {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} gets a flu shot.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_pneumonia.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Pneumococcal vaccine. Experts specializing in Down syndrome recommend that adults with Down syndrome receive PPSV23 once at age 21, again at age 25, and again at age 50. This is due to the lower overall immunity in people with Down syndrome. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not received a pneumococcal vaccine.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_pneumonia.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Pneumococcal vaccine. Experts specializing in Down syndrome recommend that adults with Down syndrome receive PPSV23 once at age 21, again at age 25, and again at age 50. This is due to the lower overall immunity in people with Down syndrome. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are not sure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has received a pneumococcal vaccine.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_hpv.value "==" "0"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

HPV vaccine. Experts specializing in Down syndrome recommend that people with Down syndrome between the ages of 9 and 26 receive the standard doses of the human papillomavirus vaccine (HPV) as in the general population. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has not received the HPV vaccine.
{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.imm_hpv.value "==" "999"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

HPV vaccine. Experts specializing in Down syndrome recommend that people with Down syndrome between the ages of 9 and 26 receive the standard doses of the human papillomavirus vaccine as in the general population. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that they are unsure whether or not {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has received the HPV vaccine.
{{/compare}} {{#if (and (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.speak_ability.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.clarity_speech.value "2") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.speak_less.value "2") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

SLP referral. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced a change in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} ability to speak. An SLP referral may be useful in determining what these changes are and why they have happened.
{{/if}} {{#if (and (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.listen_ability.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.more_instruction.value "2") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.words_understand.value "2") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

SLP referral. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced a change in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} ability to listen. An SLP referral may be useful in determining what these changes are and why they have happened.
{{/if}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.speak_ability.value "==" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.clarity_speech.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.speak_less.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

SLP and Neuropsych referral. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced a change in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} ability to speak, and indicated that {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.clarity_speech.value "==" "1"}}there has been a decrease in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}'s speaking clarity or fluency{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.speak_less.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.speak_less.value "==" "1"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} is speaking less now{{/compare}}. An SLP and neuropsychologist may help determine why these changes have happened.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.listen_ability.value "==" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.more_instruction.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.words_understand.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

SLP and Neuropsych referral. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced a change in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} ability to listen, and indicated that {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.more_instruction.value "==" "1"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} is having more difficulty following instructions{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.words_understand.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.words_understand.value "==" "1"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} is having more difficulty understanding the meaning of words{{/compare}}. An SLP and neuropsychologist may help determine why these changes have happened.
{{/if}} {{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_age ">=" "20"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pt_gender.value "==" "M"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.testicular_pmh.value "!=" "1"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Testicular/Scrotal exam. Although most solid tumors are less prevalent in people in people with Down syndrome, testicular tumors are of a slightly higher incidence in men with Down syndrome. Therefore, we encourage routine, frequent testicular exams for men with Down syndrome over the age of 20 at each well-patient visit.
{{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{/compare}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.murmur.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.poor_exercise_tolerance.value "1") )}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.asd.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.vsd.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.avsd.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.pda.value "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.tof.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Echocardiogram. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that some of their medical concerns for {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} are {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.poor_exercise_tolerance.value "==" "1"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} becoming increasingly tired after exercise{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.murmur.value "==" "1"}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.murmur.value "==" "1"}}a new murmur noticed by a doctor{{/compare}}. Even in the absence of a congenital heart condition, new valvular disorders can arise in adolescents and adults with Down syndrome. Experts recommend obtaining an echocardiogram if signs and symptoms warrant concern.
{{/if}} {{/if}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_aspiration "==" "1"}} {{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "0") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.vfss.value "999") )}} {{#if (and (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_dementia "1") (ne pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_dementia.value "1") )}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Video-fluoroscopic swallowing study. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.chewing.value "==" "1"}}more difficulty chewing in the last year{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.drinking_aspiration.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.foodaspiration.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.regurgitate.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.pills_food.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.drinking_aspiration.value "==" "1"}}coughing or clearing throat while drinking{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.foodaspiration.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.regurgitate.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.pills_food.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.foodaspiration.value "==" "1"}}coughing or clearing throat while eating solid foods{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.regurgitate.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.pills_food.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.regurgitate.value "==" "1"}}regurgitating (vomiting) after eating or drinking{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.pills_food.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pills_food.value "==" "1"}}getting food or pills stuck in {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} throat{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.food_enjoyment.value "==" "1"}}a change in appetite or enjoyment of food.{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.heimlich.value "==" "1"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} needed the Heimlich maneuver within the last week of completing the intake form.{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.heimlich.value "==" "2"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} needed the Heimlich maneuver within the last month of completing the intake form.{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.heimlich.value "==" "3"}}{{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} needed the Heimlich maneuver within the last year of completing the intake form.{{/compare}} Since {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver has also indicated that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} may not have had a Video-Fluoroscopic Swallowing Study within the past 12 months, we recommend a clinical swallow evaluation and possible Video-Fluoroscopic Swallowing Study due to concern for penetration/aspiration. In the interim, consider identifying the safest and least restrictive diet.

{{/if}} {{/if}} {{/compare}}

Potential New Conditions/Diagnoses to be Considered for {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}

We recommend that you consider initiating evaluations for the following conditions that can often co-occur with Down syndrome:

{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.pmh_depression.value "!=" "1"}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.hidden_depression "==" "1"}}
{{#i18n "checkmark"}}{{/i18n}}

Depression. {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver marked that within the past 6 months of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} has experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sad_depression.value "==" "1"}}feeling sad, downcast, or unhappy{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lack_interest_activities.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lack_interest_activities.value "==" "1"}}a lack of interest in activities{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.cries_easily.value "==" "1"}}crying easily for no reason{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.moves_slow.value "==" "1"}}moving slowly{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.lose_skills.value "==" "1"}}loss of previously learned skills{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.eat.value "==" "1"}}eating too much or eating too little{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.sleep.value "==" "1"}}trouble falling or staying asleep{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.tense_anxiety.value "==" "1"}}feeling tense, anxious, worried{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}, {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.alone_distress.value "==" "1"}}distress about being alone.{{/compare}} Generalized depression is a common co-occurring condition for people with Down syndrome. Resources and book recommendations are on our web page. Psychopharmacological consult should be considered if possible underlying medical causes can be eliminated.

Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD). {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}}’s caregiver marked that within the past 6 months of completing our intake, {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} experienced {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.ritualistic_behaviors_ocd.value "==" "1"}}ritualistic compulsive behaviors{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.obsessive_thoughts.value "==" 1}} and {{/compare}}{{/compare}}{{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.obsessive_thoughts.value "==" 1}} obsessions with ideas or activities {{/compare}} and that {{pcori_dsp_interventi.first_name}} finds these distressing, or they disrupt {{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} daily routine. OCD is a common co-occurring condition for people with Down syndrome. Resources and book recommendations are on our web page. Psychopharmacological consult should be considered if possible underlying medical causes are treated and eliminated.

{{pcori_dsp_interventi.hishertheir}} own world{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.not_respond_feelings.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.arranges_objects.value "1") (eq "==" "1"}}arrange objects in a strict order{{#if (or (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.upset_changes_routine.value "1") (eq pcori_dsp_interventi.repetitive_activity.value "1") )}}, {{else}}.{{/if}}{{/compare}} {{else}}.{{/compare}}{{/compare}} {{#compare pcori_dsp_interventi.repetitive_activity.value "==" "1"}}exhibit stimming (such as rocking, pacing, or hand-flapping).{{/compare}} We recommend considering further neuropsychological evaluation for a dual diagnosis of Down syndrome and autism-spectrum disorder.
